Query a Notion database with filtering and sorting. The input should be a JSON string containing the 'filter' and 'sorts' objects. Example input:
{"filter": {"property": "Status", "select": {"equals": "Done"}}, "sorts": [{"timestamp": "created_time", "direction": "descending"}]}

wikipedia.description: Performs a search using the Wikidata API.

wolframalpha.description: Enables queries to WolframAlpha for computational data, facts, and calculations across various topics, delivering structured responses.

xai.description: Generates text using xAI models like Grok.

yahoosearch.description: Uses [yfinance](https://pypi.org/project/yfinance/) (unofficial package) to access financial data and market information from Yahoo! Finance.

youtube.description: Retrieves detailed information and statistics about YouTube channels as a DataFrame.

youtube.description: Extracts all video URLs from a YouTube playlist.

youtube.name: YouTubeSearchComponent
youtube.description: Searches YouTube videos based on query.

youtube.description: Retrieves trending videos from YouTube with filtering options.

youtube.name: YouTubeVideoDetailsComponent
